docs.lead_paragraph: The overall health of Americans is likely to be poorer for years as a result of the deep economic recession in 1981 and 1982, according to a Johns Hopkins University professor who conducted a study for Congress that was released yesterday. ''Three to five years after the height of unemployment, we will begin to witness an increase in illness and the number of deaths,'' Prof. M. Harvey Brenner of the Johns Hopkins School of Public Health said in an interview. Similarly, he said, better economic conditions will result in lower mortality rates and other improvements in health statistics a few years from now.
